DetailContent.body: Unexplained increase in ETCO2 AND tachycardia AND increased oxygen requirement. Temperature rise is a late sign.
MH is rare. Always consider other, more common causes: →2-8 (Peri-operative hyperthermia).
START
Call for help and inform theatre team of problem, note the time.
Allocate tasks as scenario develops (Box A).

DetailContent.head: Box A: SUGGESTED TASK ALLOCATION
DetailContent.body:
1st nurse/ODP: Collect MH treatment pack/dantrolene and cold saline and insulin. Set up lines (arterial/CVC). Runner for resuscitation drugs/equipment.

2nd nurse/ODP (ideally two people): Draw up dantrolene as directed, keep notes of times of key events.

Surgeon: Complete/abandon surgery ASAP, catheterise, commence cooling manoeuvres.

2nd anaesthetist: Give dantrolene, start TIVA, manage hyperkalaemia, arrhythmias, acidosis. Renal protection (forced alkaline diuresis).

3rd anaesthetist: Arterial line. Send bloods. Central venous access. Urinary myoglobin. Monitor core and peripheral temperatures.
Aim to abandon or finish surgery as soon as possible.
Call for MH treatment pack/dantrolene and cardiac arrest trolley.
Remove vaporisers from machine.
Give highest possible fresh gas flow and hyperventilate lungs: change breathing system is NOT a priority.
Maintain anaesthesia with intravenous hypnotic agent and muscle relaxation with a nondepolarising neuromuscular blocking agent.
Give dantrolene (Box B). Delegate mixing – it is time and labour intensive

DetailContent.head: Box B: DANTROLENE
DetailContent.body:
2.5 mg.kg⁻¹ immediate intraVENOUS bolus
(Adult approx. 200 mg)
Repeat 1 mg.kg⁻¹ every 10-15 mins thereafter as required

Maximum dose 10 mg.kg⁻¹

Begin active cooling:

  • Reduce the operating room ambient temperature
  • Cooling jackets or blankets
  • Ice packing in groin, axillae and anterior neck
  • Bladder, gastric or peritoneal lavage with boluses 10 ml.kg-1 iced water
Begin continuous monitoring of: core and peripheral temperature, invasive BP, CVP.
Send urgent blood samples and repeat as indicated (Box C).

DetailContent.head: Box C: INVESTIGATIONS
DetailContent.body: Arterial blood gases every 30 mins, U&E, CK, FBC, coagulation screen, group and save/cross-match blood as indicated
Treat complications (Box D).

DetailContent.head: Box D: COMPLICATIONS AND OUTLINE TREATMENTS
DetailContent.body:
AVOID calcium channel blockers - interaction with dantrolene

Hyperkalaemia: calcium chloride, glucose/insulin, bicarbonate

Arrhythmias: magnesium/amiodarone/metoprolol

Metabolic acidosis: hyperventilate, sodium bicarbonate

Myoglobinaemia: forced alkaline diuresis (mannitol/furosemide + bicarbonate); may require renal replacement therapy later

DIC: FFP, cryoprecipitate, platelets
Plan admission to critical care.
